trans-unit.source: Manage a DocumentDB account | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Manage a DocumentDB account | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to manage your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to manage your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: How to manage a DocumentDB account
trans-unit.target: How to manage a DocumentDB account

trans-unit.source: Learn how to work with keys, consistency settings, and learn how to delete an account.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to work with keys, consistency settings, and learn how to delete an account.

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>View, copy, and regenerate access keys
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>View, copy, and regenerate access keys

trans-unit.source: When you create a DocumentDB account, the service generates two master access keys that
trans-unit.target: When you create a DocumentDB account, the service generates two master access keys that

trans-unit.source: can be used for authentication when the DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: can be used for authentication when the DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: account is accessed.
trans-unit.target: account is accessed.

trans-unit.source: By providing two access keys, DocumentDB enables
trans-unit.target: By providing two access keys, DocumentDB enables

trans-unit.source: you to regenerate the keys with no interruption to your DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: you to regenerate the keys with no interruption to your DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: account.
trans-unit.target: account.

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>,
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>Microsoft Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>,

trans-unit.source: access the Keys part from your DocumentDB Account blade to view,
trans-unit.target: access the Keys part from your DocumentDB Account blade to view,

trans-unit.source: copy, and regenerate the access keys that are used to access your
trans-unit.target: copy, and regenerate the access keys that are used to access your

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: View and copy an access key
trans-unit.target: View and copy an access key

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, access your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, access your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: In the Summary lens, click Keys.
trans-unit.target: In the Summary lens, click Keys.

trans-unit.source: On the Keys blade, click the Copy button to the right of the
trans-unit.target: On the Keys blade, click the Copy button to the right of the

trans-unit.source: key you wish to copy.
trans-unit.target: key you wish to copy.

trans-unit.source: Regenerate access keys
trans-unit.target: Regenerate access keys

trans-unit.source: You should change the access keys to your DocumentDB account
trans-unit.target: You should change the access keys to your DocumentDB account

trans-unit.source: periodically to help keep your connections more secure.
trans-unit.target: periodically to help keep your connections more secure.

trans-unit.source: Two access keys
trans-unit.target: Two access keys

trans-unit.source: are assigned to enable you to maintain connections to the DocumentDB
trans-unit.target: are assigned to enable you to maintain connections to the DocumentDB

trans-unit.source: account using one access key while you regenerate the other access key.
trans-unit.target: account using one access key while you regenerate the other access key.

trans-unit.source: Regenerating your access keys affects any applications that are
trans-unit.target: Regenerating your access keys affects any applications that are

trans-unit.source: dependent on the current key.
trans-unit.target: dependent on the current key.

trans-unit.source: All clients that use the access key to
trans-unit.target: All clients that use the access key to

trans-unit.source: access the DocumentDB account must be updated to use the new key.
trans-unit.target: access the DocumentDB account must be updated to use the new key.

trans-unit.source: If you have applications or cloud services using the DocumentDB account,
trans-unit.target: If you have applications or cloud services using the DocumentDB account,

trans-unit.source: you will lose the connections if you regenerate keys, unless you roll
trans-unit.target: you will lose the connections if you regenerate keys, unless you roll

trans-unit.source: your keys.
trans-unit.target: your keys.

trans-unit.source: The following steps outline the process involved in rolling your keys.
trans-unit.target: The following steps outline the process involved in rolling your keys.

trans-unit.source: Update the access key in your application code to reference the
trans-unit.target: Update the access key in your application code to reference the

trans-unit.source: secondary access key of the DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: secondary access key of the DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Regenerate the primary access key for your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: Regenerate the primary access key for your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>,
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>,

trans-unit.source: access your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: access your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: In the Summary lens, click Keys.
trans-unit.target: In the Summary lens, click Keys.

trans-unit.source: On the Keys blade, click the Regenerate Primary command, then
trans-unit.target: On the Keys blade, click the Regenerate Primary command, then

trans-unit.source: click Ok to confirm that you want to generate a new key.
trans-unit.target: click Ok to confirm that you want to generate a new key.

trans-unit.source: Once you have verified that the new key is available for use
trans-unit.target: Once you have verified that the new key is available for use

trans-unit.source: (approximately 5 minutes after regeneration), update the access key in
trans-unit.target: (approximately 5 minutes after regeneration), update the access key in

trans-unit.source: your application code to reference the new primary access key.
trans-unit.target: your application code to reference the new primary access key.

trans-unit.source: Regenerate the secondary access key.
trans-unit.target: Regenerate the secondary access key.

trans-unit.source: *Note that it can take several minutes before a newly generated key can
trans-unit.target: *Note that it can take several minutes before a newly generated key can

trans-unit.source: be used to access your DocumentDB account.*
trans-unit.target: be used to access your DocumentDB account.*

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html>Manage DocumentDB Consistency Settings
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html>Manage DocumentDB Consistency Settings

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB supports four well-defined user-configurable data consistency
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB supports four well-defined user-configurable data consistency

trans-unit.source: levels to allow developers to make predictable
trans-unit.target: levels to allow developers to make predictable

trans-unit.source: consistency-availability-latency trade-offs.
trans-unit.target: consistency-availability-latency trade-offs.

trans-unit.source: Strong consistency guarantees that read operations always
trans-unit.target: Strong consistency guarantees that read operations always

trans-unit.source: return the value that was last written.
trans-unit.target: return the value that was last written.

trans-unit.source: Bounded Staleness consistency guarantees that reads are
trans-unit.target: Bounded Staleness consistency guarantees that reads are

trans-unit.source: not too out-of-date.
trans-unit.target: not too out-of-date.

trans-unit.source: It specifically guarantees that the reads are no
trans-unit.target: It specifically guarantees that the reads are no

trans-unit.source: more than K versions older than the last written version.
trans-unit.target: more than K versions older than the last written version.

trans-unit.source: Session consistency guarantees monotonic reads (you never
trans-unit.target: Session consistency guarantees monotonic reads (you never

trans-unit.source: read old data, then new, then old again), monotonic writes (writes are
trans-unit.target: read old data, then new, then old again), monotonic writes (writes are

trans-unit.source: ordered), and that you read the most recent writes within any single
trans-unit.target: ordered), and that you read the most recent writes within any single

trans-unit.source: client’s viewpoint.
trans-unit.target: client’s viewpoint.

trans-unit.source: Eventual consistency guarantees that read operations
trans-unit.target: Eventual consistency guarantees that read operations

trans-unit.source: always read a valid subset of writes and will eventually converge.
trans-unit.target: always read a valid subset of writes and will eventually converge.

trans-unit.source: *Note that by default, DocumentDB accounts are provisioned with Session
trans-unit.target: *Note that by default, DocumentDB accounts are provisioned with Session

trans-unit.source: level consistency.
trans-unit.target: level consistency.

trans-unit.source: For additional information on DocumentDB consistency
trans-unit.target: For additional information on DocumentDB consistency

trans-unit.source: settings, see the [Consistency
trans-unit.target: settings, see the [Consistency

trans-unit.source: Level](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=402365) section.*
trans-unit.target: Level](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=402365) section.*

trans-unit.source: To specify the default consistency for a DocumentDB Account
trans-unit.target: To specify the default consistency for a DocumentDB Account

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, access your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, access your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: In the Configuration lens, click Default Consistency.
trans-unit.target: In the Configuration lens, click Default Consistency.

trans-unit.source: On the Default Consistency blade, select the default consistency
trans-unit.target: On the Default Consistency blade, select the default consistency

trans-unit.source: level you want for your DocumentDB account.
trans-unit.target: level you want for your DocumentDB account.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: The progress of the operation may be monitored via the Azure Preview portal Notifications hub.
trans-unit.target: The progress of the operation may be monitored via the Azure Preview portal Notifications hub.

trans-unit.source: *Note that it can take several minutes before a change to the default
trans-unit.target: *Note that it can take several minutes before a change to the default

trans-unit.source: consistency setting takes affect across your DocumentDB account.*
trans-unit.target: consistency setting takes affect across your DocumentDB account.*

trans-unit.source: <html></html><html></html> How to: Delete a DocumentDB account
trans-unit.target: <html></html><html></html> How to: Delete a DocumentDB account

trans-unit.source: To remove a DocumentDB account that you are no longer using, use the
trans-unit.target: To remove a DocumentDB account that you are no longer using, use the

trans-unit.source: Delete command on the DocumentDB Account blade.
trans-unit.target: Delete command on the DocumentDB Account blade.

trans-unit.source: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, access the DocumentDB Account you
trans-unit.target: In the <link><linkText>Azure Preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>, access the DocumentDB Account you

trans-unit.source: wish to delete.
trans-unit.target: wish to delete.

trans-unit.source: On the DocumentDB Account blade, click the Delete command.
trans-unit.target: On the DocumentDB Account blade, click the Delete command.

trans-unit.source: On the resulting confirmation blade, type the DocumentDB Account
trans-unit.target: On the resulting confirmation blade, type the DocumentDB Account

trans-unit.source: name to confirm that you want to delete the account.
trans-unit.target: name to confirm that you want to delete the account.

trans-unit.source: Click the Delete button on the confirmation blade.
trans-unit.target: Click the Delete button on the confirmation blade.
